Key Features of an Ideal Expense Management System:

Automated Expense Categorization (AI-powered):
An ideal expense management system should leverage artificial intelligence (AI) to automatically categorize expenses based on the provided description.1 For instance, when a user enters "lunch with client," the AI should recognize keywords and context to appropriately categorize it, such as "Meals and Entertainment" or "Client Meetings," without requiring manual selection from an extensive list.10 This automation significantly reduces the time employees spend on expense reports and ensures more consistent categorization across the organization.

Anomaly Detection and Flagging of Unusual Expenses:
An effective expense management system should incorporate AI-driven anomaly detection to identify unusual spending patterns that may indicate out-of-policy expenses, errors, or even fraudulent activity.5 The AI can learn typical spending behavior within the organization and flag transactions that deviate significantly from these norms, such as unusually high amounts for specific expense categories or spending outside of established timeframes or locations.
